name: The Beverly Garland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was in an excellent location for Universal (free shuttle) and within walking distance of the metro. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. Had a King size bed in a very nice room with a balcony. Good restaurant on site. Very pleased all round, and would recommend to anybody. Would definately stay there again.
reviews.title: great all round hotel
ventalation problems
reviews.text: The landscaping was nice, the people were nice, and the rates were totally reasonable. The restaurant and bar also had very reasonable rates.

However, the building with rooms has serious mold and ventalation problems. I could barely breathe in the hallways and could only manage to survive in the room with a towel on the door crack and the sliding glass door wide open.
reviews.title: The Place to be in North Hollywood!

likes.disliked: — Person in blond wig who knocked on our door at 2 a.m. wanting to clean the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The last night someone was smoking on a nearby balcony and that woke me up at 2am (they were quiet--it was just the smell). The first two nights I woke a few times from noise. I asked for a room on the side not facing the freeway, but the other road was super loud too. Both these problems wouldn't have occurred if I had simply closed my window--but, seriously, they have a problem with the air.
reviews.title: Great base for seeing LA

reviews.text: You could see peeling paint and wallpaper in the bathrooms and in the vending room on each floor it was obvious. I'm not sure what the solution is--again, the layout of the grounds is very nice so it'd be a shame to raise the building but if it was my house I would.
reviews.title: Switched Hotels to stay here!!

reviews.text: I had one of those Traveler publications with a discount coupon for this hotel, and I made a decision to stay there until I read some of the negative reviews on this web-site, so I continued to look for a coupon for another hotel in Hollywood.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place To Stay!
Nice Hotel, Safe location
reviews.text: When I arrived in California with my mom and young niece, we stayed in San Diego with family, before driving up to L.A. After showing my cousin the coupon book, he told me to stay at the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn instead of other hotels near Hollywood Blvd. because that area isn't safe at night. I took his advice because he used to live in Hollywood.

I am certainly glad I listened to my cousin! The three of us loved the hotel, the room faced the tennis courts and was very quiet, we saved parking money using the shuttle provided by the hotel for Universal Studios, my niece ate free, and the staff was so friendly we really hated for our three day stay to end. My niece keeps asking to go back to Hollywood and stay at the hotel, and I am planning a return trip
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel. Breakfast is Wonderful!!

reviews.text: this summer.
reviews.title: Garland's was Great - for the Price

reviews.text: Booked 2 rooms through priceline.com for a friday night $100. We stayed just to sleep for the night, the king size bed was very comfortable, the rooms and property overall are well maintained, older look but well maintained. Two exits from Universal Studios City Walk. We didnt use the pool but it looked very small for the size of the property. The best part of our stay was breakfast. The food was piping hot and especially loved that it was not greasy. We had eggs, home potatoes, bacon, toast, french toast, fresh fruit, freshly squeezed orange juice, pancakes and omellettes. Good breakfast spot, they even served Seattles best coffee if you asked for it. Otherwise you got folgers. I would definitely stay here again for a short visit. I may even drive by and have breakfast if im in the area.
reviews.title: Comfortable beds, really nice breakfast

reviews.text: Good place to stay if you're planning on seeing Universal Studios. A good value hotel. Breakfast and hotel bar are both good. Also has a decent pool.
reviews.title: Nice place for Universal Studios

reviews.text: hotel brilliant all facilities u could need. only criticism is shuttle bus provided by hotel finishes too early at night but thetre are buses and taxis on the road outside
reviews.title: BRILLIANT HOTEL

reviews.text: stayed there in oct 06 with husband and 21 year old daughter. reception staff not overly friendly but polite. waitresses,shuttle bus and gift shop staff very friendly,helpful and welcoming. we were given a room in the furthest block from reception on the 4th floor. long corridors, abit gloomy and very quiet. would not have liked to have walked back to our room alone and would not have let my daughter. it felt a little bit eerie and too remote from the main part of the hotel. room was big and clean though and had a small balcony overlooking the car park! free shuttle bus to universal/citywalk and will drop off/pick up from metro too. on second day access key to complex and rooms would not work.after traipsing back to reception was told we were only booked in for one night. had to show them invoice to convince them it was two nights. finally gave us updated keys but no apology for inconvenience or attitude. hotel was quite a way out from centre of la which at first was a little disappointing but after going into the centre and seeing the amount of homeless and druggies was glad we were staying a little further out. would not return to la as second visit now and not too keen on it but if i had to ,would return to beverley hotel as long as i was with a couple of other people. decent enough hotel as long as there is a crowd of you. ask to stay in part of complex nearest reception.
reviews.title: so so hotel

likes.disliked: — long gloomy corridors which were quiet and eerie

reviews.text: This hotel has a shuttle to universal studios-free, it stops at about 9 pm though, it is a great big hotel, it is quiet for the most part. It has a great pool outside. The staff is very helpful and the rooms, beds and pillows are very comfortable, they have no fridge or microwave in the rooms though. It is pricy, but worth it if your budget allows for it. The restaurant has very good breakfast.
reviews.title: Very Mellow, Comfortable Hotel, But A Bit Pricy

likes.liked: — pool and location, and free shuttle

reviews.text: On a road trip to Hollywood with my 14 & 12 year old kids (1 boy, 1 girl) we stayed at the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn. The staff was very friendly (even returning my phone after I left it at the restaurant and wasn't able to come get it myself until the next morning).
reviews.title: Kidsuite was great!

reviews.text: The kidsuite was great, though their selection of games & DVDs is extremely limited (glad we brought our own). It was great to have an empty fridge instead of a mini-bar fridge.
reviews.title: Fantastic.
Kids Suite A Plus...For Kids...
reviews.text: Only hitch was not fitting on the Universal Studios shuttle the first day. I wasn't told seating was limited so didn't hurry to get in the front of the line. We didn't fit and I was told "no standing" and I'd have to wait for the next shuttle. But we needed to be at the park for our VIP tour time, so we had to pay for a cab. Then on the trip home, the same shuttle driver let 2 guests on without seats (standing).

Recently returned from a 5 night stay at Beverly's Hotel. If you must stay in North Hollywood and like a smaller hotel with excellent, friendly service, this is the place for you. The location is close to Universal Studios and shuttle service is available throughout the day. The hotel is literally 2 min. off the 101 Freeway. Stayed in the Portola building and enjoyed a large, spotless room on the 6th floor.
reviews.title: Excellent Accomodations

reviews.text: The entire property is immaculate and the reception staff couldn't be more helpful. Several times, they printed out requested directions from their computer. The pool is easily accessible and is clean and quiet. Parking is $9/night - reasonable for the area.
reviews.title: scary room
Girl from giftshop/people from reception every day véry unfriendly!!
reviews.text: Tula's (restaurant) has a great $11.99 breakfast buffet, or you can order ala carte. Beverly's is a pleasant place to stay - and is one of the nicer Holiday Inn properties around.

reviews.title: Comfortable but EXTREMELY NOISY!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.text: I stayed at this motel after reading positive reviews on this site. Overall, the room was ok but it was scary because of the lock. It looked like someone had tried to break in as there was a deep break in the door where the security latch was. In addition, the door was loose and would move if you pushed against it even with the double locks in place. When I mentioned my concerns, I was offered an engineer but, because I felt that nothing short of a door replacement would help, I decided to wait it out as we were only there for another day. I liked the double sinks at the bathroom - this helped tremendously when we were getting dressed to go out. The dark hallways and block walls added to the scariness of this hotel. Not sure that I felt 100 percent safe and would probably not stay here again. Maid service was also inconsistent and minimal. By the way, I'm not a paranoid type person so it was unusual for me to be scared at this motel.
Hi everybody!
reviews.title: Two Nights of Noise

description: Ideal for great Family vacation or for business in a relaxed atmosphere.Free shuttle service to Universal Studios and CitWalk. Newly renovated rooms with private balconies, KidSuites, and garden setting, outdoor heated pool and lighted tennis courts. Full service restaurant where kids under 12 eat free with paying adults. Close to Universal Studios, NBC Tonight show, Disney, Warner Brothers and many other attractions.
